channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jeannie Seely, country singer and Grand Ole Opry star, dies at 85
item.description: Jeannie Seely, the soulful country music singer known for hits like "Don't Touch Me," has died at 85.

item.title: Chess grandmaster Carlsen wins at Esports World Cup
item.description: World number one Magnus Carlsen takes home $250,000 (£188,000) for winning the online competition.

item.title: After a reference to Trump’s impeachments is removed from a history museum, complex questions echo
College isn’t in the plans for many rural students despite stepped-up recruiting efforts
item.description: America’s rural high school students are less likely to go to college than their urban and suburban peers.

item.title: 8/1: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: U.S. adds 73,000 jobs in July, falling short of forecasts; Reporter’s Notebook: Diane Arbus’ photography legacy

item.title: They escaped Ukraine's frontlines. The sound of drones followed them
item.description: As technology transforms the war in Ukraine, soldiers are experiencing a new form of trauma: "Droneophobia".

item.title: Trump fires lead official on economic data as tariffs cause market drop
item.description: The move comes as a weaker-than-expected jobs report stoked fears about tariffs.

item.title: Sha'Carri Richardson arrested on domestic violence charge, police say
item.description: The incident occurred at a TSA checkpoint in Seattle, where Sha'Carri Richardson and a man got into an argument.

item.title: And Just Like That... Sex and the City reboot's third season to be its last
item.description: The season's finale will mark the end of the "Sex and the City universe", its showrunner announced.

item.title: Watch: Hot dog spill clogs US highway
item.description: Thousands of hot dogs spilled onto a Pennsylvania highway after a lorry scraped a car.

item.title: A pediatrician working in Gaza on how she finds the will to keep going
item.description: Dr. Seema Jilani is a pediatrician who has been providing medical care to children in Gaza.

item.title: Senate delays August recess for now as Trump presses for more confirmations
